author: afp
title: Sage Lenier: «L’IA n’apporte aucun avantage à la société»
text: Nouvelles technologies«L’IA n’apporte aucun avantage à la société» Selon la militante Sage Lenier, les grands patrons ont été séduits par des produits «inutiles» qui ont des conséquences «terribles pour la planète». Les entreprises technologiques ne cessent de promouvoir des produits avec de [l’intelligence artificielle](/fr/story/google-chrome-google-preparerait-une-ia-pour-effectuer-des-achats-a-votre-place-103210066) (IA) mais cette technologie est «inutile», non durable, et a créé «une crise existentielle» pour le secteur, affirme la militante pour l’environnement, Sage Lenier. «Crise existentielle» Un discours qui détonne au sein du Web Summit, qui réunit à Lisbonne le gratin des start-up et investisseurs dans les nouvelles technologies. «L’IA n’apporte aucun avantage à la société», assène l’Américaine, lors d’un entretien avec l’AFP en marge du sommet. Les grands patrons ont été séduits pour des produits «inutiles», abandonnant l’idée que la technologie doit avoir une utilité fondamentale, et maintenant, ils font face à «une crise existentielle», soutient celle qui s’est fait connaître en 2018, à 19 ans, lorsqu’elle a créé un cours à l’Université de Berkeley (Californie), intitulé «Solutions pour un futur juste et durable», auquel des centaines d’étudiants se sont inscrits. Sage Lenier a depuis fondé une association sur le même thème («Sustainable & Just Future») et espère en tirer une série documentaire. «Un gâchis d’émissions» «Certains d’entre vous peuvent être considérés comme étant les architectes, directement responsables, de la crise écologique», avait-elle lancé l’an dernier aux entrepreneurs lors de son intervention au Web Summit. Elle avait plaidé pour que l’économie circulaire, qui consiste à mettre en avant le recyclage et le réemploi, soit au cœur de la démarche des patrons de la «tech», dont les produits finissent souvent à la poubelle, alimentant le gaspillage. Appel peu entendu puisque les [géants Microsoft, Google et consorts](/fr/story/microsoft-et-openai-avancent-sur-lia-malgre-les-controverses-433929417320) continuent à produire un flux ininterrompu de produits dopés à l’IA, technologie extrêmement énergivore, ce qui semble mettre en péril la réalisation de leurs objectifs de neutralité carbone. Pour assurer leurs besoins croissants en électricité, notamment ceux de leurs centres de stockage de données, ces mastodontes se tournent ainsi de plus en plus vers le nucléaire. L’intelligence artificielle «est terrible pour la planète. C’est terrible pour les populations qui vivent là où on implante des centres de données. C’est juste un gâchis d’émissions (carbone)», fustige Sage Lenier. Le secteur de la «tech» est pourtant «la seule industrie, du moins en Amérique, qui a essayé pendant des années de se présenter comme verte, propre et pro-avenir», selon l’activiste. Et de rappeler que [Bill Gates, cofondateur de Microsoft](/fr/story/bill-gates-collecte-1-milliard-de-dollars-pour-financer-les-energies-propres-388327088135), «a écrit plusieurs livres sur le changement climatique». Futur sombre Les titans de la «tech tiennent à cette image et ont réussi à éviter jusqu’à présent l’attention et les polémiques sur les questions écologiques que peuvent connaître l’industrie de la mode ou le secteur automobile, pour Sage Lenier. «Mais dès qu’ils ont vu les opportunités avec l’IA d’augmenter les profits des actionnaires, ils ont tous foncé», dit-elle. Avec l’essor de l’intelligence artificielle, combinée à l’impact des autres industries, Sage Lenier prévoit un futur sombre. «La situation va se dégrader très rapidement. La chaîne alimentaire va se briser. Nous assisterons à une malnutrition de masse, voire une famine de masse», alerte-t-elle. Le réseau électrique devrait aussi céder. «Vous ne pouvez pas avoir de voitures sur le long terme. Peu importe qu’elles soient électriques ou non. Elles ne sont pas durables». «Nous ne pouvons pas continuer à produire 80 milliards de vêtements par an dans un futur bas carbone», poursuit la jeune femme.

author: Brian K. Sullivan
title: Fast-Moving Storm to Drop 70 Inches of Snow on Northern California
text:
(Bloomberg) -- A fast-moving storm will sweep into northern California and the Pacific Northwest this weekend, bringing high winds, heavy snow and flooding rain to the region.
Upwards of 70 inches (178 centimeters) of snow could fall in California’s high mountain ranges and 3 to 4 inches of rain may drop on lower elevations from the coast to inland areas, the US Weather Prediction Center said. The Mount Shasta Ski area may get as much as 3 feet of snow.
The storm, known as an atmospheric river, will quickly move out of the area and should be gone by late Saturday. Atmospheric rivers can deliver as much water as flows through the mouth of the Mississippi River, helping to replenish reservoirs and aquifers. But they can also cause widespread destruction.
Travel throughout California and along the Sierra Nevada range will be difficult, and the combination of winter weather and high winds could trigger power outages in the area. Sustained winds will likely reach tropical-storm strength across parts of Oregon and Northern California, with gusts reaching 70 miles per hour.
“Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines,” the National Weather Service said. “Widespread power outages are expected.”
High winds will also sweep further south, including Point Reyes and across the Marin and Sonoma County Hills, where travel will be difficult, especially for large, high-profile trucks.
©2024 Bloomberg L.P.

author: Vince Dioquino
title: Wintermute sees positive prospects for Bitcoin ecosystem post-halving - Crypto Briefing
text: With the deadline for Bitcoin's halving looming ahead, crypto firms maintain a positive outlook on the alpha crypto prospects. Share this article With just over a week until the fourth Bitcoin halving, Bitcoin is at an all-time high, having reached a peak of $73,000 just last month and reaching a consistent $70,000 weekly closing price, according to Wintermute’s latest OTC desk market update. At the same time, open interest (OI) has soared by almost 104% to $39.4 billion. This, the firm says, indicates greater institutional adoption within the centers of traditional finance (TradFi). Notably, in an interview with crypto news platform Coindesk, Wintermute’s OTC indicated that the halving could actually cause significant price action on related tokens such as $RUNE, $STX, and $ORDI. $RUNE and $STX are the two most consistent tokens in the BTC ecosystem, indicating growing interest in the Bitcoin ecosystem, especially as a potential rival to Ethereum’s dynamism. Wintermute also notes the potential of this “untapped pool” with Bartosz Lipinski of Cube.Exchange saying that the high costs and congestion associated with Ethereum will “cause it to take a backseat” while Bitcoin-based projects, like Rune, will redirect investor interest to the Bitcoin ecosystem, given its novelty. Lipinski claims that the upcoming Runes protocol (to be introduced after the halving event) could potentially overtake Ethereum L2/L1 projects like Base or Solana in terms of efficient meme coin creation. Developed by Casey Rodarmor, the Runes protocol aims to enhance Bitcoin’s functionality while minimizing its on-chain footprint. Runes allow for the issuance of various types of fungible tokens, such as security tokens, stablecoins, and governance tokens, on the Bitcoin network, potentially expanding Bitcoin’s utility and attracting more users due to near-instant and low-cost transactions. This protocol is open, and some projects are already building over it, riding on the anticipation of its launch coinciding with the halving. One such instance is RSIC, an Ordinals-based project that’s planning to release RUNE. Runestone, another project in the same space, has also distributed Runestone Ordinals to holders of existing Ordinals inscriptions. Based on Wintermute’s recent analysis, it appears that the might play out differently; with the expected price surge to come earlier than usual due to ETF inflows bringing in new investors, as reported by Wintermute and by trading firm . Bitcoin ETFs had surged in popularity upon their launch and has even led TradFi players to offer BTC investment options. On the other hand, ETH spot ETFs remain in the doldrums, what with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Share this article

author: Jess Flaherty
title: 'I'm so embarrassed about one aspect of my wedding - I'd rather elope' - The Mirror US
text:
A bride-to-be is feeling nervous about her upcoming nuptials due to her lack of close friends who can serve as bridesmaids.
A wedding is usually a monumental event that's counted down and looked forward to, but one bride wishes she could avoid it altogether. Despite being thrilled about her engagement, she's been feeling "embarrassed" and "a bit like a loser" during the wedding planning process.
She shared on Reddit she's the "stereotypical girl whose best friend is their partner with no other friends." Her fiancé, on the other hand, has a large group of friends he wants in his wedding party.
While she's happy for him, she feels "embarrassed" that he'll have groomsmen while she doesn't have a single bridesmaid. She fears it will be embarrassing standing at the altar with no one on her side while his side is full.
The bride-to-be also laments the likelihood of missing out on traditional pre-wedding events like a bachelorette party or bridal shower, with no close friends to make plans or arrangements for such things.
Despite her excitement about the prospect of being married, she admits to dreading the wedding day itself due to her anxiety over this issue. The woman shared her lack of close friends is due to growing up in a "really strict religion". When she left it, she was "shunned" and "left with no friends".
She explained: "The religion frowns upon making friends outside of the religion so I didn’t have other friends when that happened. Ever since that’s happened, I’ve had a really tough time making friends despite actively trying."
This has led her to desire an elopement or a "really small" wedding, but her partner wants a "big" wedding with everyone present.
People offered their thoughts in the comments section. One person asked: "Have you had to sit down heart-to-heart with your soon-to-be? Have you really made him listen about how you’re feeling about the big wedding and how big the disparity is between you two?
"Weddings are about unity and they’re about the couple - if half of the couple is not enjoying the wedding, why have one? I think a very big conversation needs to be had very soon."
Another suggested: "Could you go do the ceremony with just the two of you and then have a big party afterwards where nobody is expected to have any kind of specific roles? Just one big event where nobody is elevated to a particular position... it would be a lot less "his" and "her" sides".
Plenty of people advised the woman to befriend the girlfriends of her fiancé’s friends. One individual remarked: "Honestly it might be a great moment to get closer with the women in his life? My current bestie is exactly like you.
"She didn’t really have her own close friends, but the women in her husband’s life all rallied around her for wedding stuff. We all bonded a ton in the process and now we’re really close!"

author: Erik Kostrzewa
title: chevron-right
text: Several coronal mass ejections (CMEs) from the sun will impact the Earth late on May 10th. Their merger could bring an intense geomagnetic storm, leading to widespread aurora. A G4 watch has been issued as a result. The reason this is particularly rare is the majority of events are classified as G1-G3. This is also the first G4 watch since 2005. G4 & G5 storms are incredibly infrequent, but when they happen, the chances of aurora skyrocket. According to NOAA, aurora may be visible over much of the northern half of the US. If it is as intense as currently predicted, the northern lights could be seen as far south as Alabama & northern California. For us in Mid-Michigan, we typically need a G2 or G3 storm to see the aurora on the horizon/overhead. Even if this storm ends up being a bit weaker, aurora would still be possible here. However, having a G4 storm would give us a really good chance to see the northern lights. Impacts to the power grid, satellites, and radio signals could also happen during a G4 storm. The biggest question with this opportunity is if Mother Nature will even allow us to see it. Currently, the forecast does have quite a bit of cloud cover in the area. While this would block the aurora at times, there should be enough breaks to still see some colors. The strongest portion of the storm is expected between 11 PM & 2 AM. This is also when skies will be opening up a bit before more clouds develop late. As always, the further north you go, the better your chances will be. Make sure you get away from any light pollution and look up and to the north.

author: James Mickleboro
title: These were the best-performing ASX 200 tech shares of 2023
text:
The tech sector was a great place for investors to put their money in 2023.
Over the period, the S&P ASX All Technology index rose 34%. This compares favourably to a 7.6% gain by the ASX 200 index.
But if you thought that was strong, just wait until you see the top three performing ASX 200 tech shares last year. They were as follows:
Pro Medicus Limited ( ASX: PME ) The Pro Medicus share price was the best-performing ASX 200 tech share in 2023 with a stunning 73% gain. Investors were scrambling to buy this health imaging technology company's shares after it announced a series of large contract wins .
In addition, Pro Medicus impressed the market again in FY 2023 with another very strong full year result. It reported a 33.6% increase in revenue to $124.9 million and a 36.5% jump in net profit after tax to $60.5 million.
Xero Limited ( ASX: XRO ) The Xero share price wasn't too far behind with a stellar 60% gain over the period. As well as improving sentiment in the tech sector, investors were buying this cloud accounting platform provider's shares after it reported further strong growth in FY 2023 and the first half of FY 2024.
In respect to the latter, the ASX 200 tech share reported a 21% increase in operating revenue to US$799.5 million thanks to a 13% lift in subscribers to 3.95 million. This helped underpin a 65% increase in adjusted EBITDA to NZ$204.5 million.
Life360 Inc ( ASX: 360 ) The Life360 share price was on form and charged almost 56% over the 12 months. Investors were buying this location technology company's shares for a few reasons.
One was the fact that its shares had been sold off the year before leaving them at an attractive level at the start of 2023.
Another was its strong top-line growth and successful transition to breakeven ahead of schedule. For example, during the third quarter, Life360 reported a 38% increase in revenue to US$78.6 million and a 41% lift in annualised monthly revenue to $259.1 million.
The ASX 200 tech share's management team also increased its FY 2023 adjusted EBITDA guidance to US$12 million-US$16 million from US$9 million-US$14 million, which went down well with the market.

author: newsdesk@nottinghampost.com (Joseph Ash)
title: UK's oldest Second World War hero to be honoured by Spitfire flyover
text: An iconic aircraft is set to flyover a town on the Nottinghamshire border in honour of the UK's oldest Second World War veteran. Ex-Desert Rat Donald Rose is 109 and lives in Canal Vue care home on Awsworth Road in Ilkeston , Derbyshire. To honour the veteran, two spitfires will be flying over the town at around 1.45pm on May 6, as part of a larger wartime-themed celebration in the town. The spectacle is expected to draw huge crowds to a wartime-themed party for the modest old soldier, who turned 109 on Christmas Eve. Donald is the world’s fourth-oldest surviving Second World War veteran. He was born in 1914 and served on the frontline with the 7th Armoured Division after joining the Queen’s Royal Regiment. He saw action in North Africa, Italy, France, Belgium, Holland and Germany – later training as a sniper. Get the latest What's On news straight to your phone by joining us on WhatsApp The dad of one, whose wife died in 2001, was repeatedly decorated, including being given France’s highest award – the Legion D'Honneur. But his son David Rose, 74 – a retired NHS hospital technician living in West Hallam, Derbyshire, – said: “He didn’t want the medals, he wanted no fuss and he just got on with it.” Donald has said when quizzed in the past about his longevity: “Everyone asks this – there’s no secret.” In a salute to him, the Royal Air Force's Battle of Britain Memorial Flight will send two Spitfires to dip their wings as they flyover Donald and the rest of the excited onlookers. Operating from RAF Coningsby in Lincolnshire, the flight operates six Spitfires, two Hurricanes, a Lancaster, a C47 Dakota, and two Chipmunk aircraft. These aircraft can be regularly seen in the skies over the UK from May to September each year. These aircraft are often flown to celebrate and commemorate public and military events. The Battle of Britain Memorial Flight (BBMF) was inaugurated on 11 July 1957 at RAF Biggin Hill. It was initially called the RAF Historic Aircraft Flight and consisted of three PR Mk XIX Spitfires and the RAF’s last airworthy Hurricane, LF363. It was then renamed to be the Battle of Britain Flight before a final renaming in 1969 to what it is known as today, BBMF.

author: pavelp177
title: Battlefield 1 not installing on EA app - Answer HQ
text:
Battlefield not installing on EA app
When I try to install Battlefield 1 on the EA app, it gets stuck on "Preparing" at 2%, and when I try to press pause or cancel, it does not let me. I try to close the EA app, nothing happens. I open task manager, end the EA app task, and task manager along with the EA app crash, slowing down my whole PC. I have to restart, and when I go into the download location of the app, I see an 80GB Battlefield 1 folder. I open the EA app again thinking it has installed, then it asks me to download it again as if it never started, and I have to delete the large folder to make space for a new installation. This happens every time I try to download the game. I have cleared cache, I have reinstalled the EA app, I don't know what to do - I just want to play the game
